Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Migrate database from SQLite to Supabase PostgreSQL

- Replace sql.js with postgres package for Supabase connection
- Update database layer \(lib/db/index.ts\) to use postgres client
- Convert SQL placeholder syntax from ? to $1, $2, etc for PostgreSQL
- Add proper parameter binding and error handling
- Update environment variables for Supabase connection
- Create SUPABASE_SETUP.md with setup instructions
- Update CLAUDE.md to reflect Supabase architecture
- Install @supabase/supabase-js and postgres packages

This migration enables:
- Cloud-hosted PostgreSQL database with Supabase
- Proper transaction support via postgres client
- Connection pooling for better performance
- Production-ready database infrastructure
- Better scalability for multiple concurrent users

Database schema was pre-created in Supabase project: sapzbrueaipnbbazsvcl
Users need to:
1. Update DATABASE_URL in .env.local with their Supabase password
2. Run ''npm run db:init'' to create default admin user

Co-Authored-By: Claude Haiku 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: Remove env field from vercel.json and rely on dashboard configuration

The env field in vercel.json was causing schema validation errors. Since environment variables are already configured in the Vercel dashboard \(SESSION_SECRET, NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL, NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, DATABASE_URL\), we can safely remove this field. Vercel will use the dashboard environment variables during the build and runtime.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Haiku 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
